WRITING.TEXT: ugh so many feels. Watching this at work and someone is cutting onions.
I don't get it either! I remember trying it way back expecting some super cringe and it was...well...fine. Not good, but not nearly as bad as I thought.

I refuse to backpack it. Ive done plenty of trips with just a tiny crossbody bag (and i mean tiny, holds the essentials) and other people with same or guys just doing the dude thing and using pockets. Call me lazy i just dont want to carry a big bag around. But, on the other hand i see it working for some groups.
Everything else is on point, though i personally think 3-4 park days is too little!
This has been going around at work. My new favorite video on the internet. Period.
Alien Encounter. It was my fav ride as a kid (i loooove being scared) and I mourn it every time I'm there. Freakin' Stitch!
Slow Down and Enjoy It!

I use an itty bitty cross body bag, for disney and vacations in general. I like cross body because its close to me. it's big enough for my phone, camera, sunglasses, even back up battery charger. two little pockets in front for credit cards, cash, and other little things. I got it from Target. didnt cost me more than $20 and it's been going strong about 3 years now.

This sort of thing is whats holding me back on continuing part of White Night. Im at a part thats so...freakin...difficult. And I don't even want to record my constant deaths because it's just making me so angry. I can't even concentrate on the fact im recording when i get that angry playing, i want to just play the part without recording and start recording once i get past it. But maybe thats silly and I should just showcase the frustration (albeit in a tightly, shortly edited way).

Hi lovely people :) I have a youtube channel that's first and foremost a gaming channel, but being a huge disney lover, I've found a way to fit in talking about upcoming trips while playing old school disney games. I will also be vlogging both my disneyland trip in 2 weeks and disney world trip in 6 weeks, so there will def be more disney content overall. I'm certainly new at the whole youtube channel thing so im no expert but i hope you guys enjoy it! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdBVtFcCUvxHWvgoUmTLByg

For me, memories. I love going and saying "hey, remember the time we went on Spaceship Earth and this happened?" "Oh man I remember the first time I saw Illuminations..." "This reminds me of that time on ToT..." and then it's making more on top of that! I've gone to Disney with family and various groups of friends, so I have memories with a lot of important people in my life there and I just want to keep making them :)
I've seen this before when I've been there, it's so awesome. Everyone brings a little magic no matter their position!
Thank you for letting me know about the company, I just received my tank top today! I'd never have known if not for you, thank yooou!
This is fantastic! Between this and the transportation map that is mapped out like a subway system poster, they'd be perfect additions to my apartment!
I tend to steer towards youtube, because i mean, you'll find everything. But i do have to go back to d-cot. It's been a while!

The last time I attempted it, I started with a shot of tequlia at mexico, got as far as a beer in morocco, was drunk already and got distracted by Illuminations. My brain couldn't handle procedure anymore.
We're also going for Food Wine so I may need to steal your point system!

If you want more of a vlogging sort of account and not just learning, to get you pumped, I really enjoy SeeYouReelSoon. Adorable couple who goes often and just watching could have you learn a thing or two. they also have videos that are just tips, and i benefited a lot from a few, even though ive been to the parks quite a bit!
In truth, we don't know how many of those drinks they actually finished ;) could've all been for show! Their last photo though, they definitely looked over it!
that's me today. Friend instagrammed drinking around the world in epcot. every. single. country.

Yes, fireworks are at 9pm, but eating that late is just not a thing we want to do. we generally eat around 7pm...eating beyond 9pm and im not even hungry :O I was hoping if we could at least land an 8pm, we'll still be able to see fireworks but wont be leaving super late and getting our meals super late.
i'm considering it to get a better time for Cali Grill on 9/23. Right now we have 9:25 reservation, I'd like an 8pm so maybe ill give this a go!
That is an impressively long time to sit around just to take a shot like this. amazing.

Mission: Space. Maybe its more with my group of friends, but most of them are very "meh" about it. It's like...my favorite ride at Disney, period. Sure there are certain aspects that could be better, but I still love the experience.

It will be, trust me. my NYC walk comes out and i get ahead of SO many people. One time when I was down there a CM said "you're from NYC, right?" "how did you know?" "you walk so fast, weaving around people!" haha it was hilarious

I went a lot has a kid and im sure had that sort of perspective on "magic" but when it hit me when i was a bit older, i was 16, and had never seen illuminations. My family stepped outside of dinner, the fireworks were about to start, and my mom stopped in awe. Like, her mouth literally dropped and you could see the reflection of the fireworks in her eyes and we just stood side by side and took it in together. We both shed some tears in the end finale. That moment has stuck with me and Illuminations quickly became a "If i dont do it on my trip, the trip is RUINED!" sort of thing.
My mom passed away 4 years later when I was 20, and now seeing Illuminations is like having 10 minutes where I feel the most connected to her. Sounds silly, but it's true. It's become such an emotional, magical show for me.
+/u/User_Simulator /u/subject7617
where did you get that? I WANT!
isnt he lovely? i met him, jeez about 6 years ago. We had a great conversation, he signed a bust for me and we took a picture. Nicest celebrity ive ever met, still to this day!
oh wow, 57 for me! I have no idea what to do with myself but im going nuts. Watching movies, watching disney vloggers on youtube, anything I can to keep me going.
Mine was a bison burger last night. I think im exploding this morning. ugh. I feel your pain. literally.
All i could think of was, well, they just spent thousands of dollars to be there to only get themselves kicked out. I'd never risk being kicked out of disney for ANYTHING.

I am a fair regular at another disney forum, i wont name names, but it can get so catty over there and sometimes very elitist. I don't find that here at ALL. Everyone is just very welcoming, helpful, and kind :)

Weird, we got ours very early, about a month ago for our September trip! As others have said, checking in at the desk will get you on your bus for sure, so don't worry in that. But if you want them before hand I'd call ASAP.
Toy Story Midway Mania. so much nostalgia with the games and toys in it, Mr Potato Head is great. Love it. Expedition Everest is a close second, the themeing is fantastic.

Keep: Dinosaur. I find it a lot of fun, i love how terrifying it is, and i for one actually enjoy the jerkiness. makes it feel scarier. Redo: Kali. It has potential, but needs a little bit more going for it, it has some slow moments. Remove: Primeval Whirl. Just get rid of that whole section, please and thank you. Doesn't feel like Disney at all.
WOW what a photo!
4 of my party are staying at French Quarter (boyfriend and I included!) and 2 others at AKL!

First of all, we're just missing each other! I'll be there 9/22 to 9/27 (im losing my mind already waiting! pre-disney insanity!). I think your plans look good, but realistically i think they may change a bit with the kids moods. It's great you have breaks built in to your plans, super important! Have the kids done Mission Space or Tower of Terror? Are they thrill riders? I just worry they both may be intense for them, but you know them better than I (i always was a scaredy kid and didnt have the guts to go on ToT until i was 13!)
i'm the opposite. Im so scared I get "wide eyed horror" look in my eyes. I cant stop staring because im just so terrified... I live for being scared though so it's one of my favorite rides :)

It's a LOT of food and unless you spend a couple days doing it, you just can't possibly try it all without a stomach ache. I've been twice so far and going this september. Happy to see some old favorites (like the escargot, and the honey wine) and hurray for some new ones!

well thats the problem. I went with an ex, who went with the idea of "only rich kids got to go to disney when i was little so im bitter" and "its just some big corporation with mickey everywhere". sure enough, he complained the entire trip and it was the worst trip i ever had. He really hated it. So i think im traumatized!

I think it's silly. The pavilion is showcasing the history of America. It's not just waving the flag high and proud like it's something they still stand behind. I get the S.C. thing and am all for it. I don't get this.
I've never got to a water park or used a meal plan! I've also never seen any of the country films in Epcot, if a pavilion has it.
My boyfriend hasnt seen most of them either! I just got him to watch Aladdin last weekend to which he replied "ok...that was pretty good." ha!

we ARE going for food and wine! It's my favorite event there, along with Not So Scary. Though we aren't doing that, was afraid it'd be a little much for him. We're also doing dinner at California Grill one night and Flying Fish another, and to get us out of the parks a bit, we're going parasailing one morning. We're also traveling ourselves but staying during the same week as other friends, so it won't be just "us" and I'm hoping a group vibe will be good for him. I really, truly hope he has the same attitude as you in the end :)
Gives me hope my 26 year old boyfriend wont hate WDW when we go in september! (he hasnt gone since he was about 9, he's begrudgingly going with me now). Love these pics!
I have a tradition of buying a mask in Italy every trip (well, it only started about 4 trips ago, so i havent done it EVERY trip). Not super "disney" but a lovely purchase every time.

When moms hit my ankles with strollers.
No, this is not me being mad that there are kids at WDW. I love kids! If i didn't I probably wouldn't go to WDW as a kidless adult! But, I've had, on more than one occasion, moms purposely use their strollers as battering rams. Like aggressively try to tap people with it, to get through. Not "oh i hit you by accident and im sorry" because hell, it's crowded, that can happen. But i mean obviously, blatantly using it to get by. It hurts! and it frustrates me.

From a viewer standpoint: If I'm looking for a straight walkthrough, like how-to get through an area, i prefer just gameplay. No talking, just do it. but if im watching a let's play-er for fun, i want commentary!
I prefer to comment with my own videos. MY stuff would be boring if i didn't.

I play video games as it is, why not turn it into something creative? I also have a friend (who posts here often) who has really made something of his channel, and I admire that. I may not get to his point but I know I have content to create. Also im having fun just bettering my content as time goes on.
French Quarter! It'll be me and my boyfriend in one room, 2 friends in another. My brother and his girlfriend are staying AK Lodge (lucky ducks!)
Sept 22nd to 27th for us! :) can't wait to be back home!
Well, now we are!

I live with my boyfriend, who stays up far later than I. Subsequently, he wakes up much later than me on weekends, so i try to get up early. He also always says "record any time, ill be quiet!" but...he's not so quiet ha. So it's either then or once in a while if he's out with friends and im not tagging along that I can record.
Hand of Fate, worth it? I've been looking at it for a while and it's 50% off today. Need some convincing.

depends where you sit and how heavy the front of the boat is. I've gone and gotten just a bit wet and ive gone and been soaked. The heavier the front of the boat, the more it'll dip down into the water. And yes, if you sit front, you'll likely get soaked. further back ,less likely.
I'm in the same boat, but for 9/23. we have a 9:20. only other option is 5:30. Too early and too late, personally. I keep checking to see if someone cancels, crossing my fingers!
You are the exact story i *hope* happens with my boyfriend in september. It's a small, small hope...but it is there. always love reading these though because it makes me feel better.

Also not a parent, but I cried almost like a baby on my trip in 2012. My parents first took me to Disney World when i was 2 (1988). I had no recollection of it, but my dad recorded the family vacation and we had it on VHS. I was obsessed with that video growing up and especially with the Main Street Electrical Parade. I used to play the whole part of us at the parade all the time, to the point my parents told me they couldn't even deal with the music anymore. But i loved it because there was a moment where Cinderella waved right at me, and my mom was so, so happy and always pointed it out. Anyway, fast forward, me thinking I'd never get to see that parade ever again. My mom passed when I was 20, and i tie a lot of my love for disney and memories of it to her, so when i got even a bit older and it was coming back i was so excited. In 2012, i finally got to see that parade again, almost 25 years later. and I cried. It was everything to me to see it again, after obsessing my entire childhood, after losing the person who introduced disney to me and made it the wonderful place it was. I cried like a baby, with the biggest smile on my face, and probably with families look at me like "who is this young woman by herself just crying?!" man. thinking about it now is tearing me up. Of 9 visits so far, it was the most magical moment I've ever had there.
whoa onions! That was wonderful. Can't wait to have kids and surprise them!
There was a trip where i was constantly the chosen one. it was...really weird.

So this isn't quite the same scenario, but similar in having Disney be a strong tie to someone who has passed. My mom passed suddenly when I was 20 and she was pretty much the reason I got to experience Disney several times growing up. She understood the magic. And the first time I went without her I wasn't sure I could do it. And you know what? So many things made me cry that reminded me of her. And that might happen here. Emotion when you least expect it. But it's ok, embrace that and know that she'd want you to have a wonderful, magical time. It won't be a perfect trip without her but it'll be a step to healing

It's honestly a life saver for me. On OK days i can take just 1, and it slows everything down without bloat or constipation. On worse days, i start with 2 in the morning, and maybe 1 later in the day if i need to, but then i do often have that "lead belly" feeling because of it. Either way though, it does stop most issues in it's tracks, save for when i'm dealing with almost liquid. Also for me it kicks in about 20-30 minutes, which seems fast and might be a placebo effect. but it's almost consistent in that.
Thanks for clarifying, i felt like i had something wrong lol
If not a straight cab, and someone correct me if I'm wrong, you'd have to take a bus to a park or the transportation hub by mk and then another bus from the park to said resort.
yeah that text is really putting my contacts to work. thank god i got a new prescription recently. also 50 inch tv on ps4, it's TERRIBLE. and in white makes it harder!
Maintain. Even with my tradition of one day having an ice cream sundae for lunch. It's amazing I don't gain a ton of weight, but with all that walking daily, it seriously counteracts it!

This gives me hope. I'm bringing my 27 year old boyfriend (I'm 28) who hasn't been since he was a kid. He's going "for me" as he put it, but is very skeptical and feels like if it wasn't for me growing up going, he'd never go again until he has kids. He's been a bit cynical lately to the point I'm just planning things solo and telling him when I need money for tickets our something lol I sincerely hope his experience is even half yours! There's hope yet he'll at least enjoy himself

Ive always stayed at the parks, but ive never been in worse than a 10-15 minute thunderstorm/downpour. I'll browse a store, or run towards a not so popular but indoor ride. I just...dont "do" ponchos, at disney or otherwise. Id rather just enjoy the rain if im caught in it!

Not yet. This is my 10th trip in my 28 years of life coming up, and sometimes i do wonder "will this be the trip im jaded? will this be the one where it doesn't hit home the same?" so far, it hasn't happened. The sound of the train in MK still brings a smile to my face, Illuminations still a tear to my eyes, and leaving a sinking feeling in my heart. As long as those things keep happening, I know the magic is still there.

It's my favorite thing in AK! Mostly because 1)I , love thrill rides in any capacity 2) I love being scared and boy do those animatronics still get me every time! I also love the queue with the murals

I think it is and it's one of my favorite rides. People think, will I've seen it and I never have to ride it again! But I go on spaceship earth every trip, and not just for the AC lol I love love love the end when you see earth, the reveal is still beautiful

I used to make fun of the hall of presidents as a too cool kid. Then I finally went when I was about 17 and said, wait this is seriously neat! I don't think I've been since (is been 11 years) but I think I'll make a point to stop on this year's trip!
this! I literally lost my shit. I was so confused, I had no idea where i was, what was happening, and oh god why is everything practically one shotting me!

Celestial Emissary. Or as I like to call him, Blob face. He's not hard, just boring, and the constantly respawning little guys just makes this fight tedious, not fun. As far as boss design goes, I think he's just the most boring/worst.

Oh no it's not that ive never worn heels before. I just tend to wear them for actual events and special occasions and not day to day. I can wear a 4 inch heel no problem. Over that though, not so much. I have a couple of pairs i really love but just have worn for like, fancy dates and holidays or whatever. I know. I just gotta be like yup, doing it! It's just getting there is weirdly hard!

I love heels and admire them and own a few, but don't wear them nearly enough because I'm afraid of looking "too dressed up." I work at a casual office where people where whatever they want, basically. I do, from time to time, see a couple of the girls rock heels for the hell of it. But I feel always so afraid of putting them on and suddenly I look like I'm going to a fancy brunch or something. I think it's a "it's all in my head" thing, but it's also stopped me from buying any other heels. I've been eyeing [these chunky ones](http://www.clarksusa.com/us/womens/womens-medium-width/Crumble-Spice-Tan-Combi/p/26107172) for a long time and now they are on sale and i can get an additional 20% off. But then I go "well are you going to weaaar them?" and tell myself I won't have the balls to. How do I get over "I'll feel overdressed" fear? **Edit**: I bought them! Thanks for the push I needed :)

[Cole Haan canvas weekenders](http://www.colehaan.com/women%27s-pinch-canvas-weekender-black---white/D42836.html?dwvar_D42836_color=Black%20-%20White dwvar_D42836_width=B#cgid=womens_shoes_weekender start=3). I've been wearing them with everything! I have them in the black but am tempted to get the red too!

Don't have any of me in it, but it's [this](http://uniqlo.scene7.com/is/image/UNIQLO/goods_69_154664?$pdp-medium$) one. The second dress from Modcloth is [this one!](http://www.modcloth.com/shop/dresses/beachfront-bungalow-dress)

A general fashion win... wore a seersucker dress yesterday from Uniqlo and a floral, festive Modcloth dress today. Got so many compliments from people at work both days, and one co worker told me I'm "on a dress roll" and I better keep it up or they'll be disappointed. Cute dresses all week? CHALLENGE ACCEPTED! (also I feel hella pretty with so many kind comments!)
I have super low ones from old navy that dont tend to show, id give them a try. I guess it also depends on the style of flats!

Do you use those little no-show socks? I find they help a lot with sweat and stink overall. Barefoot in leather flats, i just get sweaty or at least pretty hot. But I've picked up no-show socks at both Old Navy and Uniqlo and they make a world of a difference.

I have the issues where the actual heel of the shoe bottom ends up crushing and pulling away fabric from the back. No matter how much i spend on a pair, they back always gets ripped to shreds. It may also be a way i walk problem, but it's very annoying!

Agreed. I also tend to wear some cute prints ( like I have a dress with boats on it, another with guitars as the pattern) and I definitely feel people think I'm more approachable because they scream "I have whimsical tastes which means I'm carefree and open to people"
Where are those white jeans from? Because WANT!

Me too! Beef in general. Steak, burgers, any of that, I can't do it. Once in a blue moon I'll indulge, on a weekend when I know the next morning I'll be home to face consequences. Otherwise ive completely removed it fromy my diet.

WRITING.TITLE: Multi-Tasking on the Toilet
WRITING.TEXT: Because on my worst IBS days sometimes I just have to laugh at the lifestyle, how many of you have multi-tasked when you know you'll be in and out of the bathroom a lot? It usually hits me when im getting ready for work, so I've put on makeup, brushed my teeth, even blow dried my hair while on the toilet. I'm pretty sure I've even posted here on the toilet! What about you guys? any multi taskers?
I haven't eaten chipotle in over a year :-( I miss it but not it destroying my insides.

I am actually in the process of downsizing. It's slow going but ive gotten rid of about 4 bags of clothing over the past 3 months, which is a really big deal for me. I'm trying to be honest about what i really do and don't wear.
I always say im not a hat person. I think it's because I don't know what hats work for me at all :( I want to be a fun summer hat person but I feel like they look overwhelming on me.
I shop when I'm stressed. I also sometimes shop just to have plans on the weekend, and so does my boyfriend, so that's a little dangerous.

I always vaguely heard the name Lilly Pulitzer, but never knew what it looked like. I grew up in NYC, Queens actually. I don't think, in my 28 years of life, I have actually encountered a person here who has worn it or even had accessories. Clearly, it's not something of this area. From a class standpoint, i have no say. I didn't go to a "Greek" school and i didn't run into these sorts of people. From a purely aesthetics standpoint (and this is coming from an NYC girl who LOVES color and hates that we all get stereotyped into this neutral fashion "thing" because I certainly am not that), I think the patterns are jarring, difficult to pull off on 90% of bodies, and look like cruise wear, not something you wear day to day. I greatly dislike the look and don't understand the popularity. But again, i was never really exposed to it like many of you were, so it's all just subjective i guess. I find it ugly. That's not to say i think women who wear it are ugly or have bad taste. I just personally find it ugly.
Does anyone here own Inkkas? They look SO cool but for the price and all and the style they are, I was wondering they were comfortable and worth it.
Enjoy! I adore Clarks. I've only owned 2 but would love to add more to my collection. SO comfy!
Because Bloodborne

WRITING.TITLE: I love this game so much, I decided to launch my youtube channel with it!
Taking A Disney Cynic...Advice?
WRITING.TEXT: So I'm a bit of a disney vet...maybe not to the extent of many of you, but this next trip in the fall will be my 10th (wooo!). It'll be my boyfriend's second, but the last time he went he was about 9 years old. He's a bit cynical about the disney as an adult thing, but he's coming with me (and we'll be going down with some other friends, all with overlapping days) because he knows how much I love it. He told me that's his real motivation, because he knows it means a lot to me, but at the same time he said he's admittedly not excited at all. We're going for Food Wine (he loves his beer) and I hope that helps show him there's plenty adult to do. I also want to take him to a nice dinner (maybe Flying Fish? Have had multiple recco's on that) but I mean...what do I do to make sure he doesn't end up miserable there? Maybe there's nothing i CAN do? I'm just so worried we'll spend all this money to go and he'll hate it.

WRITING.TITLE: Trying Not to Cry at Work Right Now
WRITING.TEXT: I assume my problems today are stemming from going out last night to a wine bar. I had about 3 glasses, plus a sandwich with goat cheese, and i think it was too much. I'm sitting at work and a half hour ago get terrible stomach aches, run to the bathroom and it went from just soft to liquid real fast. I was in and out of the bathroom for half an hour and I'm trying not to just cry at my desk. I know i made the dumb move of having what I had last night but I didn't expect for it to be THIS bad. I have a normal level of bad, and then once every 2 months or so, it's just liquid, i need to run to the bathroom right this second bad. And I have work to get done and meetings to go to and it's stressing me out I just want to cry :( I'm tired of this. I've had all the tests run on me, ive tried so many things to help it. Nothing. Crying sometimes feels like the only thing to do.

WRITING.TITLE: Where can I find Quality White Blouses In This Kind of Style?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

WRITING.TITLE: Random Stomach Aches
WRITING.TEXT: Guys, I hate when I have actual flare ups but another thing I hate? Totally random stomach aches. I'm talking you're just sitting there, feeling totally fine, and suddenly, stomach ache. I have one right now sitting at work which is why I bring it up. Sometimes they just pass with no bowel movement, but I don't even know WHY I get them. Its like my stomach is just like "hey, I feel like putting you in pain right now!" Sometimes it's just gas that feels like a false alarm but man, it HURTS for the minute or so it hits me. Anyone else get these?

WRITING.TITLE: Has Anyone Used the Disney Vacation Account yet?
WRITING.TEXT: It's their new savings account to save up exclusively for a trip, that can be used on the site to book packages. It doesn't seem like you can save up money for souvenirs and stuff too, though you can use left over funds to purchase a Disney gift card and I guess use that. But, it does automatic payments if you want and then can be used to book hotel, tickets, dining plan and airfare on the site. It apparently has no fees and is totally free. I'm interested as I'm going back in Sept/Oct, and wondered if anyone here has experience with it yet! https://disneyvacationaccount.disney.go.com/

WRITING.TITLE: Persistent Lower Abdomen Pain
WRITING.TEXT: Do any of you get this before a BM, or even during a day when you are flaring up? I woke up this morning with pain right below my belly button, was in and out of the bathroom like... 4 times this morning. the pain is still there, very very dully, and before every BM (which started out urgent and turned into kind of hard to pass, weird) it gets more painful and then feels better after. It's killing me. I just had to cancel lunch plans and am trying not to cancel dinner plans because of it. Any recommendations on how to help it, or is it sadly a wait it out sort of thing?

WRITING.TITLE: Any IBS Sufferers in NYC?
WRITING.TEXT: I figure with over 8 million people in this city, odds are there's a shitload (pun intended) of people who suffer from IBS, but i manage to feel often very alone with it. Especially when im suffering on the subway during my commute, it's a lonely and also terrifying thing, surrounded by strangers and just feeling bad, or worrying about an accident. Was wondering if anyone here was from NYC and could understand the idea of being in that enclosed, underground space and trying to memorize public bathrooms at various stops along your route. It's so terrible!

WRITING.TITLE: Any pattern suggestion for a dress like this? (or fabric suggestion too!)
How Did You Start Sewing With a Pattern?
WRITING.TEXT: Er, I meant WITHOUT a pattern. Crap. Anyway, For people who have crafted non-pattern wearable items, how did you start? Did you copy items you owned? Use certain measurements and math? Wrapped yourself in fabric until you figured it out? I don't have a dress form, and can't afford one currently (though ive considered the DIY method) and was wondering how to even start thinking about non-pattern clothes. Was wondering how some of you got into it/perfected it.

WRITING.TITLE: 27/F NYC looking for Snail Mail or E-Pal
WRITING.TEXT: I haven't had a penpal since I was about 6 years old. I figure I have a lot more to say now that I'm 27 than I did at 6. I live in New York City, am currently unemployed as of the past 5 months and it's been getting me down, and I think having someone to connect with in this spare time would be awesome and help my mood. I love video games (I'm currently playing Five Nights At Freddy's and Destiny), fashion (I run a fashion blog with a friend), cats (I have one! she's 10 years old and awesome) and traveling (my last big trip took me to Morocco). I am just looking for someone, either across the country or even a different country, to connect with! I'm down with snail mail or e-mails!

WRITING.TITLE: I want to make this backpack and don't know where to start
WRITING.TEXT: I've been looking up backpack patterns to get started, but a lot of them are children's ones, and when you look up travel bags, you get huge totes. I want something like this lesportsac bag, but I'm still kind of a noob at sewing and im not sure where to start. Does anyone know a similar pattern I can base it off of and tweak? Should I just try to wing it sans pattern?: http://www.ebags.com/product/lesportsac/voyager-backpack/148437

WRITING.TITLE: Some of My Collectibles! Thought I'd share! Info in comments
Thrift Haul Today, Couple Vintage Items, Couple Not
What Do Your Sewing/Crafting Areas Look Like?
WRITING.TEXT: Currently I pathetically make due with sewing on my computer desk. I have one of those multi level desks, so the top is my monitors, the middle is clear, and then there's the slide out where my keyboard and mouse is.So yup, i just put my machine up there and sew on itty bitty space. the corner of my room with fabric is a HOT mess. Anyway, im moving in 3 months and am looking for some crafty inspiration for how I should organize things and give myself a set space. So, any pics of crafting areas or even just tips on what you use to organize/make things pretty would be awesome!

WRITING.TITLE: Finished my first bag, fully lined! (Instagram link warning)
What Needles Are Best for What Fabrics?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm just curious if there's any good guides or if anyone has general recommendations of needles for certain fabrics. I know certain thicker fabrics are going to need different size needles, but I have no idea where to start when it comes to buying for my machine (a Janome 8077).

WRITING.TITLE: Went to Brooklyn Buy the Bag Housing Works, All You Can Fit in a Bag, $25. Got all this!
Proud of my mixed vintage and newer clothing haul, including $20 leather jacket!
